Module com.example.c195project
Package controllers

Class AddCustomerController

java.lang.Object
controllers.AddCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
CountryAndDivisionQuery, CustomerQuery, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddCustomerController extends Object implements CustomerQuery, javafx.fxml.Initializable, CountryAndDivisionQuery
the AddCustomerController, is responsible for managing the "Add Customer" scene, which allows the user to enter information about a new customer and save it to the database. The class implements the CustomerQuery and CountryAndDivisionQuery interfaces to retrieve and manipulate data from the database, and also implements the Initializable interface to initialize the scene and its components when it is first loaded.
Author:
Anthony Collins

    • cancelButtonClicked

      public void cancelButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      This method is called when the cancel button is clicked. It shows a confirmation dialog to the user to make sure they really want to cancel the current action. If confirmed, it closes the current window.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - cancel button being clicked. throws SQLException If an error occurs while performing the database operation.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • saveButtonClicked

      public void saveButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException, IOException
      This method is called when the save button is clicked. It checks if all the required fields are filled out, and if so, it retrieves the division ID based on the selected state/province, prompts the user for confirmation, and inserts the customer data into the database. It then loads the calendar scene and sets the scene to display it.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - clicking the save button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the SQL query
      IOException - if there is an error loading the calendar.fxml file
